body:
I know about this one.

Comes about because we don't have good shutdown semantics for client_setup
currently, so if name resolution fails and retries too late, the underlying
channel can be gone.
Plan to fix as part of the client configuration work I've started with
#2177.

On Tue, Jun 23, 2015 at 9:26 AM Michael Lumish notifications@github.com
wrote:

> This was the log:
> 
> D0622 16:26:33.869688373   10198 test_config.c:52] test slowdown: machine=4.000000 build=1.000000 total=4.000000
> [==========] Running 22 tests from 1 test case.
> [----------] Global test environment set-up.
> [----------] 22 tests from End2endTest
> [ RUN      ] End2endTest.SimpleRpc
> D0622 16:26:33.872015034   10198 server.c:429] Waiting for all channels to close before destroying server
> D0622 16:26:33.872175777   10200 server.c:434] Waiting for all listeners to be destroyed (@ 0/1)
> D0622 16:26:33.872335295   10198 iomgr.c:119] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed and executing final callbacks
> [       OK ] End2endTest.SimpleRpc (101 ms)
> [ RUN      ] End2endTest.MultipleRpcs
> D0622 16:26:34.045838583   10198 server.c:429] Waiting for all channels to close before destroying server
> D0622 16:26:34.045964666   10243 server.c:434] Waiting for all listeners to be destroyed (@ 0/1)
> D0622 16:26:34.046138710   10198 iomgr.c:119] Waiting for 1 iomgr objects to be destroyed and executing final callbacks
> [       OK ] End2endTest.MultipleRpcs (11 ms)
> [ RUN      ] End2endTest.RpcDeadlineExpires
> D0622 16:26:34.046661424   10198 server.c:434] Waiting for all listeners to be destroyed (@ 0/1)
> D0622 16:26:34.046779680   10198 iomgr.c:124] Executing final iomgr callbacks
> E0622 16:26:34.046811606   10267 sync_posix.c:48] assertion failed: pthread_mutex_lock(mu) == 0
> [       OK ] End2endTest.RpcDeadlineExpires (0 ms)
> [ RUN      ] End2endTest.RpcLongDeadline
> �[0;31mFAILED�[0m: bins/opt/end2end_test [ret=-6, pid=10198]
>
